data.title: DAXA: Traversing the X-ray desert by Democratising Archival X-ray Astronomy
data.name: DAXA
data.description: Democratising Archival X-ray Astronomy (DAXA) is an easy-to-use Python module for downloading multi-mission X-ray telescope data and processing it into usable archives. Users can acquire entire archives, or filter observations based on ID/positions/time. Supports XMM; partial support eROSITA, Chandra, NuSTAR, Swift, Suzaku, ASCA, ROSAT, INTEGRAL

evidence: "DAXA is a Python module designed to make the acquisition and processing of archives of X-ray astronomy data as painless as possible."

"DAXA is available on the popular Python Package Index (PyPI), and can be installed like this: `pip install daxa`",""Once an archive of cleaned X-ray data has been created, it can be analysed in all the standard ways..."
